title: 20 Minute Low Priority Queue...
body:
Should prompt "Are you still there?" at random intervals during the 20 minutes, and have the equivalent of a declined ready check if someone fails to answer one of the prompts.

Those leavers should have to stare a the LPQ box for the full duration!

replies.body:
I'm broken on this one.

On one hand, yes, it kinda defeats (most of) the purpose of the punishment if the person who intentionally left just alt-tabs and plays a different game while they wait it out with little to no inconvenience.

On the other hand, forcing someone to stare at the LPQ box seems like an unnecessary punishment to those that got slapped with the LPQ because of several recent internet/computer/irl problems.

Maybe make the suggested prompt-version LPQ as a punishment escalation after the current, non-prompt, version.

Edit: As pointed out to me in this thread chain, the 20min LPQ **is** one of the later punishments that leavebuster hands out after several previous punishments.

> On one hand, yes, it kinda defeats (most of) the purpose of the punishment if the person who intentionally left just alt-tabs and plays a different game while they wait it out with little to no inconvenience.

Only if you misunderstand it. "LPQ", which is not LPQ at all, is not a punishment for griefers. It's a punishment for people with bad connection, people who leave due to real life issues and kids who mismanage their time and have to go to school.

Griefers have to be banned, not tortured by staring at their screen.

They end up in the same pool no matter how you label it though.

The people who alt-f4 out of the game are going to be judged the same and assigned the same punishment as the person who had their connection drop due to shoddy ISP. It's that way out of necessity since Riot can't sort one from the other.

And this is why we have a softer punishment, the one fitting people with shoddy ISP. Not the ones who leave intentionally.

OP's suggestion presumes the opposite.
But, once again, there is no determinable way to separate the two types of people if the person who leaves intentionally doesn't give away their intention through chat.

Or rather, do you think someone who is having internet issues is still innocent if they reach 20 minute LPQ?

Ah. That explains my confusion. I was under the assumption that the 20 min LPQ was one of the early punishments handed out by the leavebuster if not the first one.

So yeah, I would be all for this.

LPQ is a joke. Seriously, pop queue and browse the internet or play another game for ~20mins. How is this considered punishment? It's a mild annoyance at best.
Serve out short bans (hours to days) instead.

(~10mins left on my queue)
This suggestion would address those issues, wouldn't it?
Nope, not if I wasn't planning on leaving my pc
A random popup with required input, without a noise/notification and without focusing the window would seem very likely to prevent browsing the net or playing a different game to me.

Then I either
A. Go play on my other account and toss the account in LPQ out the window, or
B. Go play a different game and Riot just lost a customer.

Actually, it would. Not all games lower when you're playing them, unless you lower them yourself. In fact, I play a few games like that. So if you're not paying attention, or have League's volume low/muted, you'll completely miss the pop-up.

Honestly, I doubt Riot would expect you to sit there and stare at your League client for 20 minutes for however many games you need to.

2 monitors.

It's 5 games.

The problem with LeaveBuster is it's too sensitive. You don't even have to leave the game for it to trigger on you. You could stand up during the loading screen to take a long piss and it just happens to be that game that loads within a few seconds instead of taking forever because of someones toaster like it usually does, and when you come back you've triggered LeaveBuster because it thinks you're afk.

That is where you're most definitely wrong.

I've had games where I've taken 5 minutes to do anything in game because I've had to get up to do something, whether it be going to the bathroom or taking a dog out, and I've never been hit with LeaverBuster for it.

If you're getting hit with LeaverBuster for that, then you're doing it in just about every. single. game.
Sorry, you're wrong. If you're gone that long you'll get the afk notification, that counts towards leave buster in my experience.
And I've gotten it a few times, never gotten hit by LeaverBuster. So again, you're wrong.
You're not reading the notification then.

You mean, coming back and pressing the OK or whatever button, and reading the notice that says I'll be disconnected if I don't rejoin?

Yeah, clearly I'm not reading it.

Days or hours is nothing when you can just make plans to do something else for the night or if it’s at a time you weren’t going to play anyways

Lpq forces you to actively waste your time after you’ve wasted dozens of other people’s time. IMO it should be used much more often and handed out more
excessive

The only solution is to use vpn

I think that an idea similar to your’s is what is needed. Instead of a default of these checkpoints, maybe somebody can click on a button to tell the bot “I will be AFK during the LPQ” and it won’t  give the checkpoint.  Maybe Riot could add in something that runs some kind of background check to see if the person is actually AFK or they are just using it as an excuse to not get the checkpoints and play another game or do something else on computer. If they click that they will not be AFK, the bot will do a pop up like the accept match one. With more happening closer to the end of the LPQ timer. Something like one at the 15 mark, one at the ten, one at 5, then two or three during the last 5 min of the LPQ.

I do not understand the LPQ at all. If a player DC'd or AFK that many games then just give them a ban for a few days, or allow them to only play a certain amount of ranked each day. The point of the matter is LPQ just does not make any sense at all either give them a short term ban, followed by a long term ban, followed by a perm ban. There cant be a reason that someone would DC. I would give the benefit of the doubt of 1-2 games a week, with shotty internet, power outages, real life emergencies, and whatever. I have never been in LPQ ever and I do not believe this should be a thing.

Yeah uh, that's when you make a new account, cause NOBODY has time to stare at a 20 minute box with random popups FIVE TIMES.

That's 1.5 hours. And an interruption when other windows are open.

So no, even though I FUCKING HATE LEAVERS, that's when you say goodbye to that account.

No one in their right mind would waste their time with that.

That's an interesting claim.  There are quite a number of permanently banned accounts / players right now.  How many of them do you think would sit and stare at a screen for 1.5 hours if it meant they could get those accounts back?
Less than 10%.

> [{quoted}](name=Ezlicious,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=fsL4g2Mk,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2018-10-02T18:12:36.286+0000)
>
> Less than 10%.

Okay, let's put our thinking caps on.  If you've bought even $20 of RP, that means sitting there for an hour and a half gives you a return of $13 an hour.  If you've spent $100, then that's a return of $66 an hour.  Neither of these seems like ridiculous amounts of money to have been spent on RP.

Alternatively, you can check the going rate for a level 30 account.  A bare bones level 30 account with no skins and few champions is still about $20.  An account that has more champions and skins unlocked can sometimes be upwards of a $100.

Or you can assign value to the hundreds of hours that may have gone into building an account, as well as the friends lists that were lost upon permanent ban.  Good luck valuing that though.

Given all this, do you really want to stick with the ridiculous estimate of 10%?
If you can afford waiting for 20 minutes before the game and then play full game, you have to plan your time or not join the game. It's not exactly "LPQ" but it's good as it is.

why would we have to watch low priority queue for 20 minutes, what would that accomplish other than just have really tilted people get into game which would lead to more inting flaming and leaving. This is just a terrible idea.
